intro: Plagiobothrys nothofulvus, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments. Its flowers are usually arranged in clusters and bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
